review_title: Worst management in the history of all management
job_title: Customer Experience Agent in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Great benefits and bonuses, private health care, life assurance policy
cons: I would describe working here as being trapped in ‘golden handcuffs’. The benefits are outstanding however the management in the Customer Experience department are cliquey, have no communication skills and enforce toxic positivity. They will remove tasks to look like they are being nice only to bring them back under another name. For example, the department removed ‘retentions’ however they introduced ‘continue to play’ which was retaining the player and involved the same markdowns. Customer Experience department refuse to put some changes in to writing i.e. the change of working from home to hybrid as they do not want a written record of this. No explanation was ever given regarding the refusal of written communication, instead management removed the anonymity function of internal online feedback and turned a simple question against the agent (toxic positivity). Multiple complaints raised by multiple agents regarding managers go unheard and HR refuse to listen. Instead, managers will be given a spreadsheet to work on rather then their job however employees are let go if they don’t build rapport in calls. Changes to job roles /tasks with only a days notice. You will almost certainly work more weekends than advertised in the job role without explanation. Communication between departments is extremely poor and nothing is briefed until the day of. No scope for four day work week and the concept is never taken seriously.

review_title: Couldn't care less about their employees!
pros:
Salary is good for what the job entails.
Lunches are provided free.
cons:
Employees are forced to come into the office despite 1 in 20 people in Scotland having covid at the moment. Apparently it's more important to People's Postcode Lottery that the office appears full when board members are visiting than the health safety of it's employees. When I told my manager I didn't feel safe having to be in a full office for 3 days in a row (having had covid twice before) I was told that's "not a good enough excuse"!
No consideration has been given to transport costs that employees have to pay when forced to come into the office. (These costs are much higher not than before the pandemic).
Everyday we are required to cold call former players to convince them to re-sign, this is despite the terrible economic situation and the fact that most of the players cancelled in the first place because they couldn't afford to play. Shame!
Office is very uncomfortable to work in as due to the air conditioning the interior environment is always very hot and stuffy.
Having a day off during the week never feels like a day off because I always have to work a late shift the day before and do an early shift the day after.
New system designed to allow us to listen to/analyse our own calls is nothing more than micro-management at it's worst.

job_title: Customer Experience Agent in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Fruit baskets, free gym membership, volunteer opportunities, the pay is good for a call centre but not enough for how much stress we are under
cons:
The mission of PPL is to help good causes. This would suggest that this is at the heart of the company and that they would do their upmost to treat staff fairly and like humans. Sadly this is not the case for most of those in Customer Experience. We sit with our headsets on and take cancellations, sales, complaints and admin requests. We try to give every single one of these calls 100 percent and are rewarded by having the dialler running in between these calls all day long. We are expected to beg past players to return and hound people who entered their email address on to the website. If we are told by someone on the phone that they are not interested we are expected to ‘objection handle’ until they join or hang up on us in anger. When they hang up on us we are expected to phone them back as this could have been an ‘accident’. A lot of staff have been signed off with stress and this is due to the fact that we are not robots. As a human myself i understand why they would need to be signed of with stress. I feel upset and ignored. By plonking us down on our seats and forcing us to anger strangers and take rejection constantly you batter our mental health. We are given no time to recover. 

I understand how important customer service is, the way the department is run currently is not focused on customer service. It is focused on sales and retention through any means possible. If you really want to retain players, allow us hardworking, exhausted and sad employees to focus on customer service. At the end of a long day of ‘warm’ calling, I can guarantee the people who have chosen to call are not receiving 100 percent service. 

It is impossible to explain this to any management as we are told this is ‘our job’ and we have to get on with it. This is a terrible way to deal with staff feedback and makes no sense as there are other Customer Experience Agents with completely different job roles. A lucky selection of employees were selected from a hat to receive extra training and more responsibilities. They do not need to hit targets with retention calls and do not need to dial outbound anymore. Those of us still on the phone are rarely offered the opportunity to do emails, if we are offered we are told it is a treat. I speak to people who were selected from the hat and they are actually happy going to work and do not constantly feel down and depressed. They have said they will never return to just working on the phone again. 

Many of us on the phone exceed in hitting our targets, in-spite of how much we dislike our jobs we do our best. As soon as we have hit our target the month ends and we are back to square one. Nothing is rewarded and we try to climb back up to these demanding targets again for the next month. 

We have recently been informed that there will no longer be the option to cancel subscriptions on the website and that this will all be done over the phone. Having listened to a huge number of complaints from players about how hard we make it to cancel and having read recent trust pilot reviews from customers who are deeply unhappy at needing to phone to do this, I know this will be extremely difficult for those of us who need to take these calls. 

I speak to past employees who have spoken to HR about how hard it is in Customer Experience but nothing ever changes. Looking at the comments here it would seem that this is because you do no want to hear negativity from staff.

job_title: Customer Experience Agents in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: The bonus is brilliant, and if you’re in the call centre there are some nice people. Other than that I can’t really think of any.
cons: Place is so cliquey, unless you want to brown nose your way to the top then you won’t get anywhere. Most people there are very back stabbing. You spend most of your time badgering the elderly or people who don’t want to play. Although advertised as an “inbound call centre” it is non stop outbound calls to previous or potential players 7 out of the 8 hours of your day. Communication is shocking, constantly getting in trouble due to something you’ve not been made aware of. The amount of call centre agents that have been signed off due to stress is horrendous and the companies way of dealing with that is to make you feel even worse for being off with disciplinarys being chucked about willy nilly, instead of addressing the actual reason for them having been signed off. I have been called in for a meeting with only a manager before they have told me one thing off the record and then having an “official” meeting on the record where I was told the exact opposite and the manager from the previous meeting denied what they had said to me. There have been a few instances of this where managers say one thing to you whilst making sure no one is listening and then denying they said that in the first place. There is also a lot of work place bullying, one member of senior staff in particular has their favourites but will do anything to destroy the career of others purely because they don’t like the look of them. I received many warnings from this manager for my attitude and behaviour however no other member of management or staff had ever picked up on this? All breaks are timed and heavily monitored, one member of staff was fired due to taking too many toilet breaks. This place is like modern day slavery and I would avoid at all costs.
